document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

91F9800F194C41E4AF48D9815F2D9F38.description:
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of all sources, including the Internet, Artificial
Intelligence (AI), and new technologies, as they develop.

B22494B1FF4E44A48D39E4AEA15A1E98.description:
Define the meaning and legal consequences of plagiarism and follow ethical and legal
guidelines for gathering and using information.

237F9A9B8383495B981FD959104AED32.description:
Cite primary and secondary sources for quoted and paraphrased ideas using a standard
method of documentation, such as the Modern Language Association (MLA) or American
Psychological Association (APA).

3C3D4B239DFA47A6B1CB633F4692FBE3.description: Create research products aligned with the demands of the reading and writing standards.

BFA06A4F2B92435C821C9CC121C304EA.description:
Synthesize multiple streams of information from a variety of sources to support claims and
introduce counterclaims.

6308599C9A70441CB9618BCF80860AFF.description:
Objectively evaluate primary and secondary sources for their credibility, reliability,
accuracy, usefulness, and limitations, that includes identifying their main and supporting
ideas, points of view, conflicting information, and any misconceptions or biases.

D78B844E250F47E8B69AF1710C62E615.description:
Gather and organize information from various sources, including internet resources,
electronic databases, and other technology.

188FCBE5ECCD4431B2831AE65A10BF30.description:
Formulate and revise questions about a research topic, broadening or narrowing the inquiry
as necessary.

EC0F6B54C2864371AA7A66D0C2D0392B.description:
The student will conduct research and read a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade-ten content, texts, and areas prompted by
student interest.

EA938D7A677748FFA782B42B3F26D4A3.description:
Describe possible cause-and- effect relationships between mass media coverage and public
opinion trends.

571ECCB7632440A9B7E5AB7BDA62D963.description:
Evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial, and political) behind media messages used
to determine author’s purpose, factual content, opinion, and/or possible bias.

2353B1BB268149A7A066AB608AB9EE16.description:
Examine and analyze how media messages are constructed based on varying opinions,
values, and viewpoints.

2B330A3346B548C79C2506913D83DF15.description:
Analyze, compare, and contrast visual and verbal media messages for content (e.g., word
choice and choice of information), intent (e.g., persuasive techniques, including but not
limited to ad hominem, red herring, and strawman), impact (e.g., public opinion trends),
and effectiveness (e.g., effect on the audience).

E99E8D0F6BC3466C992FB50B8ABA7AC7.description:
Analyze the viewpoint of print and digital publications (e.g., advertisements, editorials,
blogs, and websites).

38B8DD4FBB8E456197F80B73A7F7886D.description: Create media messages for diverse audiences and purposes.

4E0DE06EC50F4E3888C9C4F8B1BB043B.description: Monitor, analyze, and use multiple streams of simultaneous information.

0F28C2BC64C3413388052331BEA3A330.description:
Make strategic use of multimodal tools, including using information from two or more
interdependent modes of communication where both or multiple modes are essential to
convey the intended message (e.g., graphics, moving images, music).

858B47052B334786B85E7788163AAFB1.description:
Memorize and accurately recite a speech with intonation, meaningful expression, and
emotion that conveys the intended mood (e.g., inspiration, motivation, conviction).

55748F9F05104919BADE584126C0AE1E.description:
Evaluating the effectiveness of presentations, including the introduction, central
ideas, organization, and conclusion.

47975CFFE86A4C44B6BE3EE74CC7D94B.description:
Using active listening and speaking strategies effectively with awareness of verbal
and nonverbal cues (e.g., appropriate facial expressions and posture).

74CFD114EACF4BCA883156FEF1C0806C.description:
Choosing vocabulary, language, and tone appropriate to the topic, audience, and
purpose.

FCEB998FAD07452C9FE63385897B803C.description: Report orally on a topic or text or present an opinion. This includes:

42DC4686E73F4876ADE8FA72046541C3.description:
Using reflection to evaluate one's own role in the process in pairs or small-group
activities.

3DB565D3C9864B83845E6B8AF6EE32EB.description:
Assessing, evaluating critically, and using information accurately for a common
purpose or goal.

BCE6A55AEE9245B2A78965037903B568.description: Summarizing points of agreement and disagreement.

05C95C4D07E14E80A5DDB2767453EA4E.description:
Responding thoughtfully, respectfully, and tactfully with evidence to diverse
perspectives.

3C32A40E597442C2BCC082B475B8745E.description: Setting clear goals and deadlines and defining individual roles as needed.

66A82D90DB9C44C699FB4283A53C2214.description:
Incorporating all group members in the development of new understandings,
making decisions, and solving problems.

21C62C4DFD6440A8A5EE817919A8CFC6.description: Setting guidelines for group presentations and discussions.

A6D2F5432D954CC8BDA684CC40FD4FA7.description:
Applying a variety of strategies to listen actively and speak purposefully and
respectfully.

6C2E330A94F54C4383BD03AFA66E6D51.description:
Facilitate and contribute to a range of sustained collaborative discussions with diverse
partners on grade ten topics and texts. This includes:

38A0B696A6EF485BA833AD6497F4EB8C.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

F7419609FB5941CC9AD1C4D23FB9767B.description: Spell correctly, consulting reference materials to check as needed.

C9484C18C91048B9BB1B55420D1AAE6E.description:
Apply a style manual, such as that of the Modern Language Association (MLA) or the
American Psychological Association (APA), to apply rules for punctuation and formatting
of direct quotations in writing.

47A38C2FBB56452FA207BF085291A0C6.description:
Know and apply the rules for the use of a colon (e.g., joining independent clauses,
introducing a list, introducing a quotation) when writing.

E8E78B43FC7C4B54AD7C30CEC5023A66.description: Maintain consistent verb tense when speaking and writing.

EDA2B74D4CB74D058796FE718DFE9880.description:
Use subordination, coordination, apposition, and other devices to indicate the relationship
between ideas clearly.

752924F54323413A947C293317B6D2D7.description:
Recognize and use active and passive voice to convey a desired effect in speaking and
writing.

D97EE1B0B2094951A33ED7D9D6443C86.description:
Use complex sentence structure (made up of main and subordinate clauses and
subordinating conjunctions) to infuse sentence variety in writing.

70699221D57C48E69FCB079918BA801D.description: Use, edit, and revise parallel structure across complex sentences and paragraphs in writing.

CF6125A65CEA438FA15793198D7B71A8.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

CB6C55824E964C6289C5CFA763CCE191.description:
Edit writing for appropriate conventions, style, and language (See Language Usage for
grade level expectations).

2D109F570C4649B088F4B44C4AE3B6AB.description:
Use peer- and self-evaluation to edit writing for clarity and quality of information,
addressing strengths and making suggestions regarding how writing might be improved.

C413CE1A13D64105A6EA5CA3696D543B.description: Revise writing for clarity of content, accuracy, and adequate elaboration.

A0F3E1EAEE18426D84CAD9C0E07DBB39.description:
Elaborating ideas clearly through intentional word choice and varied sentence
structure.

2BAEADD7EC0A48C8871A4C0AFD84F5F9.description: Using transitions effectively to connect ideas within and across paragraphs.

664ACDCAAABE4886AF420842F40E6071.description:
Embedding narrative techniques (e.g., anecdotes, dialogue, and description) to
develop and enhance writing.

75FD6F5832704C48B268145F27AA24D5.description:
Defending a position using sufficient reasons with evidence from credible sources
as support.

E126E7A5332C4C298613EA30C62DCEEB.description:
Introducing and developing central idea(s), and organizing ideas in a logical
sequence to exhibit unity.

4D0568C3FCEF4549AF8A53F44BC7A173.description:
Composing a thesis statement that clearly communicates the writer’s position or
assertion.

0A02C977D3194843843791B0AE421C08.description:
Plan and organize writing to address a specific audience and purpose using the writing
process (planning, drafting, revising, editing). This includes:

C4EE80B1CF844481B550840B10C93805.description:
Develop flexibility in writing by routinely producing shorter and longer pieces that adapt
writing content, technique, and voice for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences, (e.g.,
summaries, reflections, descriptions, critiques, letters, poetry, narratives, etc.).

063E69ADB19B4B5EB4274D6C1838B29D.description:
Write reflectively in response to readings in which students compare two or more texts
with details, examples, and other textual evidence to support an idea or position.

816A6DBDD5C2427D856DC9AAA953532A.description: Provide conclusions that follow from and support the argument presented.

176631992A234F75B6BAC296C3430E7A.description:
Support well-defined points of view effectively with relevant evidence and clear
reasoning in ways that logically advance the claim(s).

341DCCB221684C45A998008CCC21B78E.description: Develop a thesis that demonstrates knowledgeable judgements.

92F16A0797BC4016ABA9A74B10C2BFAB.description:
Provide a concluding section that follows from the information or explanation
presented.

F4F69E7BA13F4376A747F83C5172FC8A.description:
Develop the topic through sustained use of the most significant and relevant facts,
concrete details, quotations, or other information from multiple authoritative
sources appropriate to the audience’s knowledge.

10DB85B6E28F4220B259772A662C2B99.description:
Adopt an organizational structure that clarifies relationships among ideas and
concepts.

29BD4B3F13E14B1E9A24E65452B002BE.description:
Introduce a topic clearly by providing context, presenting well-defined theses, and
previewing what follows.

3D5D1AC307234EA687D4B36EAF3095C8.description:
The student will write in a variety of forms for diverse audiences and purposes linked
to grade ten content and texts with an emphasis on argumentative writing.

4D462B0B751D43339D8D4B9BE42D680A.description:
Analyze multiple texts addressing the same topic to determine how authors reach similar or
different conclusions.

8D1BCB5309BB45DBA8AEBA83C35523AB.description:
Evaluate how different authors write about the same topic and shape their presentations or
viewpoints of key information using facts, opinions, and reasoning.

5074BF6A47CE4D8EBC35911483B1DAC3.description:
Analyze the author’s purpose and impact of literary techniques such as hyperbole, analogy,
and paradox as they appear in texts.

F242156DF49545DB8C3F8ACF9024F493.description:
Analyze key terms (e.g., words and phrases, technical terminology) and ideas of historical,
scientific, and technical texts to clarify the relationships and understandings among key
concepts.

0C517602D7274CE9907ECA00A53E5C7F.description:
Analyze how authors use structure to explain relationships among concepts in a text,
including how key sentences, paragraphs, and sections of texts contribute to the whole.

613AA4F163FA441CB2500D722CED6410.description:
Evaluate the argument and specific claims in texts, examining whether the reasoning is
valid, the evidence is relevant, and whether there are any false or unsupported statements.

093EBD5A92864142BA42FF7ABABBE8AA.description:
Compare characteristics of the information from informational, historical, scientific, and
technical texts and interpret the use of data and information in maps, charts, graphs,
timelines, tables, and diagrams.

E14763E9D99849E7947F503DB2251FD1.description:
Explain how authors organize an analysis or series of ideas or events, including the order in
which points are made, how they are introduced and developed, and the connections that
are drawn among them.

1CA23B77AC764556AF7DF42E15A932E0.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from grade-level complex informational texts read.

48E58FFD7C3E43AA91C18BF182060021.description:
Analyze the similarities and differences represented in the literature of different cultures
and eras.

DDCA36F464EA448CA59192A9E91FF300.description:
Compare and contrast character development, dramatic plot structure, and conventions in a
play to character development, narrative structure, and conventions in other literary forms.

0D22469701B24C4EA8155EE6B48CDC96.description:
Explain and analyze the influence of the historical and cultural context of a text on its form,
style, characters, and point of view.

A6E915A866604A03B1A899C85BCFCFD3.description:
Analyze point of view and distinguish between what is directly stated in a text from what is
implied or intended because of the use of satire, irony, sarcasm, and understatement.

2444D257F20A4104886FA86CD64CE5A3.description:
Analyze how authors use specific word choices, syntax, tone, and voice to convey the
author’s intent and viewpoint.

9FB8AF86E93E46E29D0F0F4037D24311.description:
Analyze how authors use literary devices and figurative language, including allusion,
allegory, and paradox to impact the meaning of the text.

2A08ECA554524EF684F6F3F4BD633F8D.description:
Explain the overall structure of a poem, including how each successive part builds on
earlier sections and how rhyme, rhythm, sound, and imagery convey a message and elicit a
reader’s emotions.

F9E15A064ED343DA935BC610B3843E24.description:
Identify and explain how dramatic conventions (e.g., soliloquy, aside, narration, direct
address to the audience) contribute to the theme and effect of plays from various cultures.

964F6030F7FE4523BD291EE76E304795.description:
Describe the different character roles in literary texts (e.g., foil, tragic, hero) and their
impact on the theme.

6802A98542E64B6D8F76E5C259103901.description:
Analyze how authors structure texts to advance the plot, explaining how each event gives
rise to the next or foreshadows a future event.

03AB72431CC8433AAF2CB223D1074A0D.description:
Analyze the development of universal themes (e.g., survival of the fittest, coming of age,
power of love) prevalent in world literature (e.g., short stories, poems, plays, novels, and
literary nonfiction) of different cultures and eras.

3507E1DD132D45458DDB359A5A78479C.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts read to include literary
nonfiction (including world, British, and American literature), narratives, poetry, and
drama, with an emphasis on world literature.

D1401FE46C594914832C9220E7E8CC07.description:
Use newly learned words and phrases in multiple contexts, including in students’
discussions and speaking and writing activities.

AD9400554A12424CA1297A9B17A1ADB3.description:
Explain the meaning of literary and classical allusions and figurative language in context
and analyze their roles in texts.

1149880F94E045609F5299863CB89682.description: Identify and explain idiomatic language in context.

24DE933772A94E6DBCCF5C185E0C8539.description:
Discriminate between the connotative and denotative meanings and interpret the
connotation(s).

B71338B8D9BA40AC850B0C0A6A066912.description:
Use structural analysis of roots, affixes, and etymology to clarify the meanings of
unfamiliar and complex words.

8BEC55A47B4C4D0D8B2F905D19ADD8A2.description:
Use context and sentence structure to clarify the literal and figurative meanings of words
and phrases.

3B2C1D0B967C42348A63E88CDAC6A25A.description:
Develop and accurately use general academic and content-specific vocabulary through
reading, discussing, and writing about grade-level texts and topics.

7B02AEA27CB94277B7B486A4E1FCF9EA.description:
The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on grade
ten content and text.

64CB86C8A60748BA8AF5EA7D17B74806.description:
Use reading strategies as needed to aid and monitor comprehension when encountering
challenging sections of text. These sense-making strategies attend to text structure,
common organizational structures, summarizing, asking questions of the text, and others
(Reading Strategies, 3-12).

3EBF586EAB6B4D3EBB6CF54C3D561AF9.description:
Regularly engage in reading a series of conceptually related texts organized around topics
of study to build knowledge and vocabulary (These texts should be at a range of
complexity levels so students can read the texts independently, with peers, or with modest
support.). Use this background knowledge as context for new learning (Deep Reading on
Topics to Build Knowledge and Vocabulary, K-12).

0CE36F3914B54B0695977AF2D74DA3ED.description:
When responding to text through discussions and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from grade-level complex texts to support claims, conclusions, and inferences,
including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where relevant
evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

7D23BCBCC9C4456A9F3A1F3AAB70B646.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend a variety of literary and informational texts that exhibit
complexity at the higher range of the grades 9-10 band (See the Quantitative and
Qualitative Analysis charts for determining complexity in the Appendix.) (Text
Complexity, 2-12).

5C7B8FE0778A45BDA6ED1BEC3F0C4DCF.description:
Read a variety of grade-level complex text with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate,
and meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor
while reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, as necessary
(Reading Fluency, K-12).

8805420B674341728A290FBB3819DCF3.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading a range of
challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and gathering evidence from
grade-level complex texts, reading widely on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and
vocabulary, and using reading strategies when comprehension breaks down.

E76272A46C0846ECA1A98EBAC9E8BA5B.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina
